title: My English teacher makes formative assignments worth 0% of our grade and summative worth 100% of our grade, is that okay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Teachers have a right to determine grades in any way that they like within the school’s guidelines, which are usually very broad. They just have to make clear in advance what the grading criteria will be, and then stick to what they said they would do.

We have a school-wide policy of 20% formative and 80% summative. You can't pass by simply doing all assigments. Personally, I hate using educational theory language in grading policies and reducing all assignments to one of two categories. I much prefer the days when participation, daily work, quizzes, tests, and papers/projects had assigned weights.
